_prev_prog_3.Description: The Sulfur Dioxide System incorporates several release and containment safeguards.  These include: a dedicated, heated block building around the equipment, and automated ventilation system triggered by dual SO2 sensors, dual rupture disc/releif valve systems on the storsge tank with pressure sensors/alarms, local and remote level and pressure indicators, low vacuum, high temperature, low temperature interlocks and cathodic protection to prevent evaporator corrosion.  In 2002, three automatic isolation valves with remote and off site triggering capabilities were added to the SO2 tank.  Surveillance Cameras with motion sensors and alarms were added to the SO 2 building and loading docks with remote and off site access.

At this Elementis facility we use Sulfur Dioxide, which is considered a toxic gas by the EPA.  Safety of the community and employee is our first priority.  We s

trictly follow all federal and state regulations including:  Process Safety Management, (1910.119) Sara Title III, Emergency Action and Fire Prevention Plan (1910.38) and the Respirator Protection Plan. (1910.134) Through safety training, testing, respons

e drills, procedure reviews, safety devise checks and preventative maintenance, USFilter operates the facility for Elementis Chromium and strives to provide the safest plant possible to both the community and the employees.

\par }\pard\plain \ql \li720\ri0\widctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl0\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\aspalpha\aspnum\faauto\adjustright\rin0\lin720\itap0 \fs20\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\fs24

ncludes mutual aid response with Elementis Chromium.   All the USFilter operators and Maint. technicians are 40 hr Hazmat certified and participate in yearly response drills.  The emergency response plan includes notification to Elementis security, Wilmin

gton Hazmat team and the Castle Hayne Fire Department.

\par

At this Elementis facility, we purify Sodium Sulfate for Elementis Chromium.  In the purification process, Sulfur Dioxide is used to reduce Hexavalent 

chrome to Trivalent chrome.  The liquid Sulfur Dioxide is received by truck every 2-4 months, with a maximum on-site storage capacity of 83,000 lbs.  The storage tank is located in its own building with dual gas detectors and an automatic ventilation syst

em.  The liquid SO}{\fs24\sub 2}{\fs24  is transferred to the SO}{\fs24\sub 2}{\fs24  evaporator, heated to a gas, and fed to the process via vacuum injection.

\par 

\par {\pntext\pard\plain\hich\af0\dbch\af0\loch\f0 3.\tab}}\pard \ql \fi-720\li720\ri0\widctlpar\jclisttab\tx720{\*\pn \pnlvlbody\ilvl0\ls1\pnrnot0\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent360\pnsp120\pnhang{\pntxta .}}\aspalpha\aspnum\faauto\ls1\adjustright\rin0\lin720\itap0 {

\par }\pard \ql \li0\ri0\widctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl0\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\aspalpha\aspnum\faauto\adjustright\rin0\lin0\itap0 {\fs24\ul 

\par }\pard \ql \li720\ri0\widctlpar{\*\pn \pnlvlcont\ilvl0\ls0\pnrnot0\pndec }\aspalpha\aspnum\faauto\adjustright\rin0\lin720\itap0 {\fs24 Worst Case Scenarios \endash  Complete failure of the full Sulfur Dioxide storage tank would resu

lt in the release of 83,000 lbs of Sulfur Dioxide gas.  Using the EPA\rquote 

s RMP * Comp modeling program, the distance to toxic endpoint is 19 miles.  Complete tank failure is highly unlikely as the tank is protected with relief valves and a brick building.  Also, as the liquid SO}{\fs24\sub 2}{\fs24 

 evaporates to a gas and escapes, the bulk liquid temperature dro

ps, reducing the release rate to near zero before the tank is empty.

\par 

\par 

\par 

\par 

\par 

\par 

\par Alternative case Scenarios \endash  The alternate case assumes the tank is over filled.  The 3\'94 pressure relief valve opens for 10 minutes.  Using the EPA\rquote 

s RMP * Comp modeling program, the distance to toxic endpoint is 6 miles and the quantity released is 3,480 lbs.  While this release extends beyond the USFilter boundaries, there are no public receptors 

within the 0.3 mile radius.  Elementis  is the property owner within the radius.

\par 

\par

s Process Safety Management.  Compliance with PSM inclu

des:  a comprehensive mechanical integrity plan, initial hazop study, detailed procedures,  procedure revision review and approval, Management of change, and training Procedures, testing and documentation.

\par 

\par Highlights of our Release Prevention program incl

ude:  weekly safety equipment/interlock checks, daily process checks and documentation, rupture disc failure and alarms prior to any gas release, pressure relief valve testing and certification, UT thickness testing, yearly refresher testing and SCBA dril

ls, pressure and levels available locally and remotely at the control room and pressure and

temperature interlocks designed to minimize release. 

\par

\par }{Our emergency response program includes the four Veolia operators donning level B suits with mutual aid back-up from Elementis\rquote s Emergency Response Team.  The ERP describe

s 6 typical emergencies, which can occur during loading or operation and  a suggested response for each.  Non-essential personnel from both Elementis and Veolia are instructed to shelter-in-place.  The Veolia control room includes an emergency HVAC shutdo

w

n switch.  The USFilter operator notifies Elementis security, Castle Hayne fire and Wilmington Hazmat (both via 911) of the emergency.  Elementis then sounds their emergency siren, instructing all personnel and visitors to report to their assigned zone fo

r a head count.  

\par \page 

\par Veolia operators and Maint. technicians are 40 hr. Hazmat certified and participate in a typical drill twice per year.  Veolia held an

Emergency Responders Conference in the Spring of 2002.

\par

as constructed in 1997 and was designed and constructed per ASME, state and local codes.  Two documented changes have been made to the process piping to improve safety.  Refresher training and Mutual Aid drills will continue.  Strict adherence to the comp

r

ehensive mechanical integrity, operating procedure and safety checks will be maintained, insuring as safe a process as possible.  Remote isolation valves were added in June of 2002 and can be operated from the USFilter control room and remotely using PC a

n

ywhere. Man down alarms with automatic phone notification were added in 2002 . Six surveillance cameras that have motion sensors and remote alarms were also added in 2002.  We have added an Asset Management Survey that goes beyond PSM compliance. For 2004

,  we are sending plant personnel off site to train in PSM and RMP.
